ItemType.description: Represents a single item found in search results. It contains some metadata about the item found along with the UMM representing the item. umm won't be present if the item represents a tombstone.

MetaType.description: CMR level metadata about the item found. This represents data not found in the actual metadata.

provider-id.description: The identity of the provider in the CMR

native-id.description: The id used by the provider to identify this item during ingest.

concept-id.description: The concept id of the item found.

revision-id.description: A number >= 1 that indicates which revision of the item.

revision-date.description: The date this revision was created. This would be the creation or update date of the item in the CMR.

user-id.description: The id of the user who created this item revision.

deleted.description: Indicates if the item represents a tombstone

format.description: The mime type of the original metadata

collections.description: The collections associated with the variable.

concept-id.description: The concept id of the item found.

revision-id.description: A number >= 1 that indicates which revision of the item.

Alias.description: The alias for the name of a variable.

LongName.description: The expanded or long name related to the variable Name.

Units.description: The units associated with a variable.

DataType.description: Specify data type of a variable. These types can be either: uint8, uint16, etc.

Dimensions.description: A variable consists of one or more dimensions. An example of a dimension name is 'XDim'. An example of a dimension size is '1200'. Variables are rarely one dimensional.

ValidRanges.description: Valid ranges of variable data values.

Scale.description: The scale is the numerical factor by which all values in the stored data field are multiplied in order to obtain the original values. May be used together with Offset. An example of a scale factor is '0.002'

Offset.description: The offset is the value which is either added to or subtracted from all values in the stored data field in order to obtain the original values. May be used together with Scale. An example of an offset is '0.49'.

FillValues.description: The fill value of the variable in the data file. It is generally a value which falls outside the valid range. For example, if the valid range is '0, 360', the fill value may be '-1'. The fill value type is data provider-defined. For example, 'Out of Valid Range'.

VariableType.description: Specify basic type of a variable. These types can be either: SCIENCE_VARIABLE, QUALITY_VARIABLE, ANCILLARY_VARIABLE, OTHER.

VariableSubType.description: Specifies the sub type of a variable. These types can be either: SCIENCE_SCALAR, SCIENCE_VECTOR, SCIENCE_ARRAY, SCIENCE_EVENTFLAG, OTHER.

Characteristics.description: The characteristics of a variable.  The elements of this section apply to a Variable.

SizeEstimation.description: The size estimation information of a variable.

MeasurementIdentifiers.description: The measurement information of a variable.

SamplingIdentifiers.description: The sampling information of a variable.

ScienceKeywords.description: Controlled Science Keywords describing the measurements/variables. The controlled vocabulary for Science Keywords is maintained in the Keyword Management System (KMS).

Sets.description: The set information of a variable. The variable is grouped within a set. The set is defined by the name, type, size and index. For example, Name: 'Data_Fields', Type: 'General', Size: '15', Index: '7' for the case of the variable named 'LST_Day_1km'.

AcquisitionSourceName.description: The acquisition source name such as an instrument short name or simulation name to which the variable belongs. The acquisition source name is used to help determine uniqueness along with Name, Units, and Dimensions in the metadata content for each variable metadata record. For more information please see https://wiki.earthdata.nasa.gov/display/DUTRAIN/UMM-VAR+uniqueness

CharacteristicsType.description: The elements of this section apply to a variable.

IndexRanges.description: This element describes the x and y dimension ranges for this variable. Typically these values are 2 latitude and longitude ranges, but they don't necessarily have to be.

GroupPath.description: The full path to the variable within the Granule structure. For example, '/MODIS_Grid_Daily_1km_LST/Data_Fields'.

IndexRangesType.description: The index ranges consist of a LatRange and a LonRange.

LatRange.description: The LatRange consists of an index range for latitude.

LonRange.description: The LonRange consists of an index range for longitude.

CoordinatesType.description: The coordinates consist of a latitude and longitude.

SizeEstimationType.description: The elements of this section apply to variable size estimation.

AverageSizeOfGranulesSampled.description: This element contains the average size for the sampled granules in bytes.

AverageCompressionInformation.description: This element is a list of 1 or more average compression rate(s) as a ratio for the granule in the specified format. The size estimation service takes this information so that it can calculate the approximate downloadable size for the variable.

AverageCompressionInformationType.description: This type defines the container for a specific rate as a ratio for the granule with the accompanying file format.

Rate.description: This element contains the average compression rate as a ratio for the granule for the specified format.

Format.description: This element contains the file format that the size estimation service supports for the given rate as a ratio for the granule to be able to predict the size of the downloadable product.

MeasurementIdentifierType.description: The elements of this section allow authors to provide community sourced words or phrases to further describe the variable data.

MeasurementContextMedium.description: This element describes the context/medium within which the measurement was made.

MeasurementContextMediumURI.description: This element contains the URI for the context/medium.

MeasurementObject.description: This element describes the object which was measured.

MeasurementObjectURI.description: This element contains the URI for the object which was measured.

MeasurementQuantities.description: This element contains the quantity or quantities which was/were measured.

MeasurementQuantityType.description: The elements of this section apply to a measurement name. The measurement name is structured according to the form defined by Scott Peckham. This is: <object>_<quantity>.

Value.description: This element describes the value for the quantity which was measured.

MeasurementQuantityURI.description: This element contains the URI for the quantity which was measured.

SamplingIdentifierType.description: The elements of this section apply to a measurement.

SamplingMethod.description: The name of the sampling method used for the measurement. For example, 'radiometric detection within the visible and infra-red ranges of the electromagnetic spectrum.

MeasurementConditions.description: The measurement conditions of the variable. For example, 'Sampled Particle Size Range: 90 - 600 nm'.

ReportingConditions.description: The reporting conditions of the variable. The conditions over which the measurements of the variable are valid. For example, 'STP: 1013 mb and 273 K'.

FillValueType.description: The fill value, fill value type and fill value description of the variable in the data file. The fill value is generally a value which falls outside the valid range. For example, if the valid range is '0, 360', the fill value may be '-1'. The elements of this section apply to the fill value of a variable.

Value.description: The fill value of the variable in the data file.

Type.description: Type of the fill value of the variable in the data file.

Description.description: Description of the fill value of the variable in the data file.

SetType.description: The elements of this section apply to variable sets.

Name.description: This element enables specification of set name. For example, 'Data_Fields'.

Type.description: This element enables specification of set type. For example, if the variables have been grouped together based on a particular theme, such as wavelength, then the type should be set to that theme, otherwise it should be set to 'General'.

Size.description: This element specifies the number of variables in the set. For example, if the number of variables in the set is fifteen, the size should be set to '15'.

Index.description: This element specifies the index value within the set for this variable, For example, if this varible is the third variable in the set, the index value should be set to '3'.

ValidRangeType.description: Valid range data value of a variable: minimum and maximum values. For example, '-100, 5000'.

Min.description: Minimum data value of a variable. For example, '-100'.

Max.description: Maximum data value of a variable. For example, '5000'.

CodeSystemIdentifierMeaning.description: This element can be used to specify a code system identifier meaning. For example, 'Open Shrubland' corresponds to '7'.

CodeSystemIdentifierValue.description: The code system identifier value is the textual or numerical value assigned to each meaning.

DataTypeEnum.description: This element is used to identify the data type of the variable.

DimensionType.description: A variable consists of one or more dimensions. An example of a dimension name is 'XDim'. An example of a dimension size is '1200'. Variables are rarely one dimensional.

Name.description: The name of the dimension of the variable represented in the data field. For example, 'XDim.

Size.description: The size of the dimension of the variable represented in the data field. For example, '1200'.

Type.description: The type of the dimension of the variable represented in the data field. For example, if the dimension has a special meaning, i.e., a latitude, longitude, pressure, height (or depth) or time, then the type should be set to either 'LATITUDE_DIMENSION', 'LONGITUDE_DIMENSION', 'PRESSURE_DIMENSION', 'HEIGHT_DIMENSION', 'DEPTH_DIMENSION' or 'TIME_DIMENSION', otherwise it should be set to 'OTHER'.

VariableTypeEnum.description: This element is used to classify the variable as a Science Variable, Quality Variable or Ancillary Variable. If a variable does not contain this field, it will be assumed to be a science variable.

VariableSubTypeEnum.description: This element is used to further classify the variable as a Science Scalar, Science Vector, Science Array, Science Event Flag. If a variable does not contain this field, it will be assumed to be a science vector.

AcquisitionSourceNameType.description: The unique short name of the Instrument, Simulation, or other acquisition source. This type matches the PlatformShortNameType that is found in UMM-C.

ScienceKeywordType.description: Enables specification of Earth science keywords related to the collection.  The Earth Science keywords are chosen from a controlled keyword hierarchy maintained in the Keyword Management System (KMS). The valid values can be found at the KMS website: https://gcmdservices.gsfc.nasa.gov/kms/concepts/concept_scheme/sciencekeywords?format=csv.

LongNameType.description: The expanded or long name related to the variable name main element.

KeywordStringType.description: The keyword string type for science keywords. The pattern below helps to minimize the types of characters allowed in the keywords to help users minimize keyword issues.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Lon.description: The expanded or long name related to the variable name main element.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Dat.description: This element is used to identify the data type of the variable.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Dim.description: A variable consists of one or more dimensions. An example of a dimension name is 'XDim'. An example of a dimension size is '1200'. Variables are rarely one dimensional.

Name.description: The name of the dimension of the variable represented in the data field. For example, 'XDim.

Size.description: The size of the dimension of the variable represented in the data field. For example, '1200'.

Type.description: The type of the dimension of the variable represented in the data field. For example, if the dimension has a special meaning, i.e., a latitude, longitude, pressure, height (or depth) or time, then the type should be set to either 'LATITUDE_DIMENSION', 'LONGITUDE_DIMENSION', 'PRESSURE_DIMENSION', 'HEIGHT_DIMENSION', 'DEPTH_DIMENSION' or 'TIME_DIMENSION', otherwise it should be set to 'OTHER'.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Val.description: Valid range data value of a variable: minimum and maximum values. For example, '-100, 5000'.

Min.description: Minimum data value of a variable. For example, '-100'.

Max.description: Maximum data value of a variable. For example, '5000'.

CodeSystemIdentifierMeaning.description: This element can be used to specify a code system identifier meaning. For example, 'Open Shrubland' corresponds to '7'.

CodeSystemIdentifierValue.description: The code system identifier value is the textual or numerical value assigned to each meaning.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Fil.description: The fill value, fill value type and fill value description of the variable in the data file. The fill value is generally a value which falls outside the valid range. For example, if the valid range is '0, 360', the fill value may be '-1'. The elements of this section apply to the fill value of a variable.

Value.description: The fill value of the variable in the data file.

Type.description: Type of the fill value of the variable in the data file.

Description.description: Description of the fill value of the variable in the data file.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Var.description: This element is used to classify the variable as a Science Variable, Quality Variable or Ancillary Variable. If a variable does not contain this field, it will be assumed to be a science variable.

This element is used to further classify the variable as a Science Scalar, Science Vector, Science Array, Science Event Flag. If a variable does not contain this field, it will be assumed to be a science vector.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Cha.description: The elements of this section apply to a variable.

IndexRanges.description: This element describes the x and y dimension ranges for this variable. Typically these values are 2 latitude and longitude ranges, but they don't necessarily have to be.

GroupPath.description: The full path to the variable within the Granule structure. For example, '/MODIS_Grid_Daily_1km_LST/Data_Fields'.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Ind.description: The index ranges consist of a LatRange and a LonRange.

LatRange.description: The LatRange consists of an index range for latitude.

LonRange.description: The LonRange consists of an index range for longitude.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Siz.description: The elements of this section apply to variable size estimation.

AverageSizeOfGranulesSampled.description: This element contains the average size for the sampled granules in bytes.

AverageCompressionInformation.description: This element is a list of 1 or more average compression rate(s) as a ratio for the granule in the specified format. The size estimation service takes this information so that it can calculate the approximate downloadable size for the variable.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Ave.description: This type defines the container for a specific rate as a ratio for the granule with the accompanying file format.

Rate.description: This element contains the average compression rate as a ratio for the granule for the specified format.

Format.description: This element contains the file format that the size estimation service supports for the given rate as a ratio for the granule to be able to predict the size of the downloadable product.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Mea.description: The elements of this section allow authors to provide community sourced words or phrases to further describe the variable data.

MeasurementContextMedium.description: This element describes the context/medium within which the measurement was made.

MeasurementContextMediumURI.description: This element contains the URI for the context/medium.

MeasurementObject.description: This element describes the object which was measured.

MeasurementObjectURI.description: This element contains the URI for the object which was measured.

MeasurementQuantities.description: This element contains the quantity or quantities which was/were measured.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Mea.description: The elements of this section apply to a measurement name. The measurement name is structured according to the form defined by Scott Peckham. This is: <object>_<quantity>.

Value.description: This element describes the value for the quantity which was measured.

MeasurementQuantityURI.description: This element contains the URI for the quantity which was measured.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Sam.description: The elements of this section apply to a measurement.

SamplingMethod.description: The name of the sampling method used for the measurement. For example, 'radiometric detection within the visible and infra-red ranges of the electromagnetic spectrum.

MeasurementConditions.description: The measurement conditions of the variable. For example, 'Sampled Particle Size Range: 90 - 600 nm'.

ReportingConditions.description: The reporting conditions of the variable. The conditions over which the measurements of the variable are valid. For example, 'STP: 1013 mb and 273 K'.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Sci.description: Enables specification of Earth science keywords related to the collection.  The Earth Science keywords are chosen from a controlled keyword hierarchy maintained in the Keyword Management System (KMS). The valid values can be found at the KMS website: https://gcmdservices.gsfc.nasa.gov/kms/concepts/concept_scheme/sciencekeywords?format=csv.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Key.description: The keyword string type for science keywords. The pattern below helps to minimize the types of characters allowed in the keywords to help users minimize keyword issues.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Set.description: The elements of this section apply to variable sets.

Name.description: This element enables specification of set name. For example, 'Data_Fields'.

Type.description: This element enables specification of set type. For example, if the variables have been grouped together based on a particular theme, such as wavelength, then the type should be set to that theme, otherwise it should be set to 'General'.

Size.description: This element specifies the number of variables in the set. For example, if the number of variables in the set is fifteen, the size should be set to '15'.

Index.description: This element specifies the index value within the set for this variable, For example, if this varible is the third variable in the set, the index value should be set to '3'.

umm-var-json-schema.json_definitions_Acq.description: The unique short name of the Instrument, Simulation, or other acquisition source. This type matches the PlatformShortNameType that is found in UMM-C.

hits.description: The total number of items that matched the search.

took.description: How long the search took in milliseconds from the time the CMR received the request until it had generated the response. This does not include network traffic time to send the request or return the response.

items.description: The list of items matching the result in this page.
